channel.title: Botting inside a Vps?
channel.description:
Is it possible to open an RSBot in a vps??
I didn't try tho... I think it will mess it up..
DISCUSS!!

item.title: Botting inside a Vps?
item.dc:creator: @The_UpFallz The UpFallz
item.description:
@The_UpFallz wrote:

Ahah, I Make 250American Dollar’s week for Botting like 45 Account’s on my dedicated. :L

Read full topic

item.title: Botting inside a Vps?
item.dc:creator: @spy_man47 spy man47
item.description:
@spy_man47 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:13, topic:343358”][quote author=spy man47 link=topic=439753.msg3232389#msg3232389 date=1276196747]

You can do it on command line linux without running a VNC server too, it’s called X forwarding. You just connect to the ssh server with the -Y parameter (like ssh -Y user@host.com), then you can run graphical programs and the UI will show up on your computer, even though it runs on the server. Of course you have to have an X server running on your computer, but if you are in Linux you already do.

So linux is x better than windows?
[/quote]

I don’t understand the question really. I of course think linux is better than windows, especially for anything server related. I believe they make a X server for windows though, if thats what you mean.[/quote]

Yeah that is what I exactly ment, btw Thanks for the edvices…

Read full topic

item.title: Botting inside a Vps?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“spy man47, post:12, topic:343358”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=439753.msg3232272#msg3232272 date=1276184570]
You can do it on command line linux without running a VNC server too, it’s called X forwarding. You just connect to the ssh server with the -Y parameter (like ssh -Y user@host.com), then you can run graphical programs and the UI will show up on your computer, even though it runs on the server. Of course you have to have an X server running on your computer, but if you are in Linux you already do.
[/quote]

So linux is x better than windows?[/quote]

I don’t understand the question really. I of course think linux is better than windows, especially for anything server related. I believe they make a X server for windows though, if thats what you mean.

Read full topic

item.title: Botting inside a Vps?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You can do it on command line linux without running a VNC server too, it’s called X forwarding. You just connect to the ssh server with the -Y parameter (like ssh -Y user@host.com), then you can run graphical programs and the UI will show up on your computer, even though it runs on the server. Of course you have to have an X server running on your computer, but if you are in Linux you already do.

item.title: Botting inside a Vps?
item.dc:creator: @spy_man47 spy man47
item.description:
@spy_man47 wrote:

[quote=“Natey, post:8, topic:343358”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=439753.msg3231832#msg3231832 date=1276133054]

[quote author=Natey link=topic=439753.msg3231827#msg3231827 date=1276132863]

[quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=439753.msg3231822#msg3231822 date=1276132391]

[quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=439753.msg3231694#msg3231694 date=1276121466]

Is it possible to open an RSBot in a vps??

I didn’t try tho… I think it will mess it up…

DISCUSS!!

Nah, unless your VPS is CLI only. Then you can’t. Hmm, I sense a new bot project…
[/quote]there’s no such thing as a vps being cli only…it simply depends on whether his vps is running a desktop environment or not

[quote author=Natey link=topic=439753.msg3231819#msg3231819 date=1276132185]
Yeah if it’s a windows vps.
[/quote]or linux…

[/quote]I prefer windows because I can remotely view it, too much work for me on linux
[/quote]…you can remotely view it on linux too, it’s called a vnc server
[/quote]some people aren’t that smart :/[/quote]

Oh ok ty

Read full topic
